subject: Sales
title: The Twitter Pitch
description: A quick win: understand The Twitter Pitch.

hook.text: Y Combinator investors ask: 'Describe your startup in a tweet.' Under 280 characters. No excuses.

buildup.text: The Twitter pitch demands ruthless compression. If you can't say it briefly, you haven't found the core.

discovery.text: Uber's early pitch: 'Push a button, get a ride.' Airbnb's: 'Book rooms with locals.' Simple and sticky.

twist.text: Lengthy descriptions signal unclear thinking. The shortest pitches emerge from the deepest understanding.

climax.text: Write your pitch in 280 characters. Every word you cut makes what remains more powerful.

punchline.text: The shorter the pitch, the sharper the thinking.

quiz.question: What does a Twitter-length pitch test?
options: How deeply you understand your own value proposition
